column2: Directing, supervising and assisting in nursing services in accordance with management policies and other regulatory standards.      Evaluating the performance of subordinates by monitoring individual work performance and obtaining feedback from patients, physicians and other personnel in order to accurately evaluate associates.      Performing daily rounds in all the wards, Operation Theatre (OT), critical areas and ER.      Doing surveillance of antibiotic usage, identifying and reporting epidemiological variations in levels of diseases to the Infection Control Committee and implementing the recommendations of the committee.      Compiling and interpreting surveillance data and presenting the infection rate at the weekly or monthly audit meeting.      Supervising ward cleanliness and diet provided to patients.      Maintaining patient census, collecting data based on the culture sent to the laboratory.      Arranging classes for nurses; coordinating with GM, Nursing/ANS in conducting the classes.      Maintaining reports regarding classes, informing all nursing staff about event discussions.      Supervising the proper disposal of biomedical waste.      Conducting and organizing orientation programmes.      Coordinating with ANS in administering training and development programmes to nurses.      Maintaining regular contact with physicians and staff in order to identify and resolve problems.      Additional responsibilities entrusted by the units.

column2: JKKN Institute of Sresakthimyil College of Nursing and Research is seeking a highly motivated and qualified individual for the position of Associate Professor in the Department of Child Health Nursing. The successful candidate will be responsible for teaching and conducting research in the field of child health nursing. The candidate will also be expected to assist in the development of new courses and programs in the department.           Responsibilities:         Teach courses in child health nursing, including but not limited to child growth and development, pediatric nursing, and neonatal nursing.     Conduct research in the field of child health nursing and publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals.     Assist in the development of new courses and programs in the department.     Serve on departmental and college committees as assigned.     Advise and mentor undergraduate and graduate students in the department.     Engage in professional and community service activities.             Qualifications:         A PhD in child health nursing or a related field.     A record of scholarly publications in peer-reviewed journals.     A minimum of 5 years of teaching experience in child health nursing at the undergraduate and/or graduate level.     Demonstrated ability to develop and conduct research in child health nursing.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.             Eligible Fields:         Child Health Nursing      Pediatric Nursing      Neonatal Nursing      Child Growth and Development      Child and Adolescent Mental Health      Community Child Health         Note:               Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Ward Nurse to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Patient Assessment and Monitoring:Conduct initial and ongoing assessments of patients' health status     Monitor vital signs, observe changes in patients' conditions, and report any concerns to the healthcare team     Administer medications and treatments as prescribed by physicians     Perform procedures such as wound care, injections, and IV therapy     Patient Care Planning and Implementation:Develop individualized care plans based on patients' needs, diagnoses, and treatment plans     Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to coordinate patient care     Provide emotional support and education to patients and their families regarding their conditions, treatments, and self-care techniques     Documentation and Record Keeping:Maintain accurate and detailed medical records of patients' assessments, care plans, interventions, and outcomes     Document medication administration, treatments, and procedures according to hospital policies and procedures     Safety and Infection Control:Adhere to infection control protocols and procedures to prevent the spread of healthcare-associated infections     Ensure a safe environment for patients, staff, and visitors by following safety standards and regulations     Implement fall prevention strategies and measures to minimize patient risks     Communication and Collaboration:Communicate effectively with patients, families, and healthcare team members to promote continuity of care     Participate in patient care conferences, rounds, and multidisciplinary meetings     Serve as an advocate for patients' rights and preferences     Professional Development:Stay updated on current nursing practices, standards, and evidence-based interventions     Participate in continuing education programs, workshops, and in-service training sessions     Pursue professional certifications and licensure renewal as required

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd  is looking for SICU Nurse  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Patient Care:          Provide direct and individualized nursing care to critically ill surgical patients.      Perform thorough patient assessments, including monitoring vital signs, surgical sites, and postoperative complications.      Administer medications, intravenous therapies, and advanced life support measures as prescribed.      Assist with and perform specialized procedures, such as wound care, chest tube management, and ventilator management.              Postoperative Management:          Monitor patients in the immediate postoperative period for complications such as hemorrhage, infection, and respiratory distress.      Assess and manage pain, nausea, and other postoperative symptoms.      Collaborate with surgeons and anesthesia providers to optimize patient outcomes.              Critical Care Expertise:          Operate and maintain advanced medical equipment, including ventilators, monitors, and infusion pumps.      Respond promptly to changes in patients' conditions and initiate appropriate interventions.      Implement and evaluate care plans, adjusting treatments as necessary in consultation with the medical team.              Collaboration:          Work closely with surgeons, anesthesiologists, nurse practitioners, and other healthcare professionals to develop and implement patient care plans.      Participate in multidisciplinary team meetings and contribute to patient care discussions.      Coordinate care with other departments and services, ensuring continuity of care.              Documentation and Compliance:          Maintain accurate and detailed patient records, documenting all aspects of patient care and interventions.      Ensure compliance with hospital policies, procedures, and regulatory standards.      Participate in quality improvement initiatives and adhere to best practices in surgical critical care nursing.

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd  is looking for NICU Nurse  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    The NICU Nurse is responsible for providing specialized nursing care to critically ill neonates and premature infants in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit      This role requires advanced knowledge and skills in neonatal nursing, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to work in a high-stress environment      The NICU Nurse must provide compassionate care to infants and support to their families        Key Responsibilities:       Provide comprehensive nursing care to neonates requiring intensive medical attention      Perform detailed assessments of neonates, including vital signs, physical exams, and developmental assessments      Administer medications, treatments, and interventions as prescribed by neonatologists      Monitor and document neonates responses to treatment and progress      Operate and maintain specialized NICU equipment, including incubators, ventilators, and monitors      Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, including neonatologists, respiratory therapists, and other healthcare professionals      Educate and support parents and families, providing guidance on infant care and development      Maintain a safe, clean, and organized environment in the NICU      Participate in emergency interventions and resuscitation efforts as necessary      Adhere to hospital policies, procedures, and protocols, including infection control and safety guidelines      Engage in ongoing education and professional development to stay current with advancements in neonatal care

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd  is looking for Labour Room Nurse  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    The Labour Room Nurse provides high-quality care to women and newborns during labor and delivery      This role requires expertise in obstetric nursing, the ability to manage complex clinical situations, and the provision of compassionate support to patients and their families      The Labour Room Nurse plays a critical role in ensuring a safe and positive birthing experience        Key Responsibilities:        Assess and monitor maternal and fetal health during labor, delivery, and postpartum      Administer medications, epidurals, and other treatments as prescribed by physicians      Assist in the preparation and management of delivery rooms and equipment      Support and coach patients through labor, delivery, and postpartum recovery      Perform and assist with clinical procedures such as vaginal exams, fetal monitoring, and episiotomies      Provide immediate care to newborns, including Apgar scoring, initial assessments, and resuscitation if needed      Educate patients and families on labor processes, pain management options, postpartum care, and newborn care      Maintain detailed and accurate medical records, documenting patient progress and clinical interventions      Collaborate with obstetricians, midwives, anesthesiologists, pediatricians, and other healthcare professionals to provide coordinated care      Adhere to hospital policies and protocols, including infection control and safety guidelines      Participate in continuous education and training to stay current with advancements in obstetric and neonatal care

column2: JOB SPECIFICATION -       ?     IVF NURSE DGNM / PB B.SC(N) / B.SC (N) / M.SC(N). Tamil Nadu Registered Nurse. Knowledge of current nursing practice A minimum of 3+ years of experience in clinical Field Should be good in Communication, Email and Telephone etiquette.        ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES      ?         Assist Consultants, Gynecologists, Physicians and Medical Officers during their rounds in the hospital       On admission, measure and note temperature, pulse, BP and other vitals of the patient and inform the Medical officer/Assistant Gynecologist Assist the technician for ECG Give injections, start pint or other procedures as advised by consultant Carefully shift the patient to the OT as per planned time     Shift the patient back to his/her room/ward and again follow the order of consultant Keep Patient relative and attending doctor well informed on the condition of patient after the procedure/surgery     Taking rounds of the patient at regular interval and fill up vitals of the patients as per nursing sheet     Explain the patients relative to visit the drug store and pay for the drugs used in the OT as per prescription     Perform the following activities before discharge: Give medicines, operation CD, reports and discharge card if applicable to the patient Remove VIGO/Urine bag etc     as per nursing protocol Check all the vitals like, Nausea, Vomiting, fever, BP etc     of the patient Check the payment status of the patient     Wave a happy and get well soon goodbye to the patient and assure them that they will be fine soon and in case of any query they can always contact respective Doctor

column2: We are seeking a skilled and compassionate Phlebotomist to join our healthcare team     As a Phlebotomist, you will be responsible for drawing blood samples from patients, ensuring patient safety and comfort throughout the process     Your attention to detail, strong communication skills, and commitment to following proper procedures will be essential for testing     The ideal candidate should have a thorough understanding of phlebotomy techniques and a dedication to providing high-quality patient care         Responsibilities:               Perform venipuncture and skin punctures on patients using proper phlebotomy techniques.     Verify patient information and accurately label collected specimens, ensuring proper documentation and adherence to protocols.     Maintain a clean and organized phlebotomy workspace, including proper disposal of sharps and biohazardous materials.     Interact with patients in a professional and compassionate manner, ensuring their comfort and addressing any concerns or questions.     Educate patients as per the training imparted.     Follow established safety protocols and infection control procedures to minimize the risk of contamination and ensure patient and staff safety.         Qualifications:               High school diploma or equivalent.     Completion of an accredited phlebotomy training program or certification.     Proven experience as a Phlebotomist, demonstrating proficiency in venipuncture and skin puncture techniques.     Excellent knowledge of phlebotomy procedures, including proper handling and labeling of specimens.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with patients of diverse backgrounds and ages.     Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in specimen collection, labeling, and documentation.     Knowledge of infection control protocols and procedures to maintain a sterile environment.     Familiarity with medical terminology and laboratory processes related to specimen handling and testing.     Ability to work efficiently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a high level of professionalism and patient care. column2: DRL Healthcare is looking for Deputy Nursing Superintendent / Assistant Nursing Superintendent to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Observing and recording patients' behavior      Coordinating with physicians and other healthcare professionals for creating and evaluating customized care plans      In order to provide emotional and psychological support to the patients and their families, RNs create a harmonious environment      Diagnosing the disease by analyzing the patient's symptoms and taking required actions for his/her recovery      Maintaining reports of patient's medical histories, and monitoring changes in their condition      Carrying out the requisite treatments and medications
